definition: Classical Chinese name for planet Venus in the west after dusk
age/seventh of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/seventh in order/letter "G" or Roman "VII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 255°/hepta

sentences.english: You must wait for M/V Chang Geng clear entrance before leaving berth.
sentences.chinese: 在离泊前你船必须等“长庚”船让开入口。

sentences.english: The KCGMH-LTP performed the first living donor liver transplant without transfusion of blood or blood products in the world.
sentences.chinese: 高雄长庚医院完成全球首例未输血活体肝脏移植手术。

sentences.english: Professor Chao-Long Chen was appointed the 3rd Superintendent of KCGMH.
sentences.chinese: 陈肇隆教授接任第三任高雄长庚医院院长。

sentences.english: The Peking Opera Master Cheng Changgeng launched a movement of redressing modernizing the drama costumes.
sentences.chinese: 京剧泰斗程长庚发起了一次“整饬装具”运动。

sentences.english: Methods 22 cases were treated with Changgeng's methods .
sentences.chinese: 方法应用长庚法修复22例单侧唇裂。

definition: Classical Chinese name for planet Venus in the east before dawn
beta Ursae Majoris in the Big Dipper
epsilon Ursae Majoris in the Big Dipper
surname Qi/also used in place names
Mercury in traditional Chinese astronomy/see also 水星[shui3 xing1]
Ziyang County in Ankang 安康[An1 kang1], Shaanxi
surname Zhu/abbr. for 天竺[Tian1 zhu2] India (esp. in Tang or Buddhist context)/Buddhism (archaic)
